intro: Vandellia limosa, commonly known as the slender vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, violet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanists and horticulturists alike.
